subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 8, 2007

TOP STORIESParis Ordered Back To Jail
Paris Hilton was taken from a courtroom screaming and crying, seconds after a Los Angeles judge ordered her returned to jail. More...Watch: Paris Hilton Flies The Coop
• Wife Sentenced For Killing Preacher• Pace Out As Joint Chiefs Chair
                     					| Watch• U.S. Relaxes Passport Rules For N. America
                     					| WatchU.S.Immigration Collapse A Blow To Bush
The Senate's failure to pass a broad immigration bill was a major political blow to President Bush. Also in the loser column
                        was the Senate's Democratic leadership and perhaps GOP presidential hopeful John McCain.   More...Watch: Immigration Reform Debate
• Slaying Suspect May Have Had MySpace Page
                     					| Watch• Parents Dispute Claims About Missing Girl
                     					| Watch• U.S. Relaxes Passport Rules For N. America
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldSpain Arrests U.S. Terror Suspect
Spanish law enforcement officers have arrested a Syrian man wanted in the U.S. on suspicion of supplying arms to Colombian
                        rebel groups. Monzer al-Kassar faces extradition to New York, where he will face terrorism charges. More...
• Report: CIA Ran Secret Prisons In Europe• G-8 Leaders Back U.N. On Iran Sanctions
                     					| Watch• Gunmen Raid Iraq Cop's House, Kill 14
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsRep. William Jefferson Pleads Not Guilty
The Louisiana Democrat indicted this week on 16 counts in relation to a bribery case pleaded not guilty to charges of racketeering,
                        money-laundering and soliciting. Congress is launching investigations into his possible explusion. More...Watch: Rep. Jefferson: I'm Innocent
• Immigration Collapse A Blow To Bush
                     					| Watch• Lawyers Want Libby Sentence Delayed
                     					| Watch• Pure Horserace: John McCain's Bad Day
                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealthPot Chemical May Curb Inflammation
The active ingredient in marijuana may curb inflammation and help treat skin allergies, researchers report in Science. More...
• Movie Headaches Vex Real-Life Doctors• New Migraine Drug Promising• Hormonal Fix for Unwanted Hair?• More StoriesSciTechNASA Hopes For Change With Shuttle Launch
Since the beginning of the year, NASA has endured an astronaut's arrest in a bizarre love triangle, a workplace murder-suicide
                        and a freak hail storm at the launch pad. What it hasn't had is a space shuttle launch. More...Watch: Another Setback For NASA
• MIT Shows How To Cut The (Power) Cord• G-8 Leaders Reach Climate Deal
                     					| Watch• More DC Panda-monium Possible This Summer• More StoriesBusinessStocks Take Another Hit
Stocks fell for a third straight day as rising bond yields deflated hopes that the Federal Reserve might cut interest rates
                        later this year. The Dow industrials fell nearly 200 points. More...
• Mortgage Reform Unlikely This Year• Buying A New Car? Don't Despair• What's Your Policy On Insurance?• More StoriesEntertainment"The Sopranos" Reaches The End
On the premiere of "The Sopranos" eight long years ago, Tony was asked by his psychiatrist, Dr. Melfi, if he had any qualms
                        about how he made his living. More...Watch: The End Of Tony Soprano?
• Isaiah Washington Out Of "Grey's Anatomy"• Sambora Enters L.A. Treatment Facility• Sarah Jessica Parker Debuts Clothing Line• More StoriesOpinionOn The Fringe, But Also On Point
Presidential candidates like Dennis Kucinich, Mike Gravel and Ron Paul have no chance of winning anything, but their presence
                        on the debate stage is vital to the health of their parties, the Nation says. More...Watch: GOP Debate Focuses On Iraq
• Not-So-Terrifying Terrorists
                     					| Watch• The Press At The Polls• Republicans Should Quit Playing Nice
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Travel: Summer Travelers Face Turbulence
Summer vacationers may face some tough travel issues this year, ranging from new passport regulations to flight delays. Terry
                        Trippler, an aviation expert from cheapseats.com, offered some advice on The Early Show.   More...Watch: U.S. To Relax Passport Rules

G-8 Pledges AIDS Aid To AfricaPresident Bush was absent from morning G-8 talks, but joined other world leaders later in the day to reach a landmark agreement
                                    to fight AIDS and other diseases in Africa. Gwen Belton reports.
